job-details: Position SummaryIPA Ghana is seeking a (Senior) Project Manager to lead IPA Ghana‚Äôs provision of evidence- and data-driven technical assistance to policy and implementation partners for the differentiated learning (DL) scale-up in Ghana. In response to findings from the Strengthening Teacher Accountability to Reach All Students (STARS) evaluation, Ghana's Ministry of Education has incorporated DL into the Ghana Accountability for Learning Outcomes Project (GALOP), a US$219 million fund from the World Bank, Global Partnership for Education, and FCDO. The fund will pay for the implementation and scale-up of effective education solutions in 10,000 of the lowest-performing schools in Ghana, including DL based on the STARS model. IPA‚Äôs role in ensuring its successful implementation at scale will be critical for future intervention and innovation and understanding pathways to scale in Ghana and beyond. The (Sr.) Project Manager will be accountable for implementing all of IPA‚Äôs support for the DL scale-up. The (Sr.) Project Manager will lead the relationship with government partners and other key local stakeholders, coordinate activities led by other IPA teams, and manage project scope, delivery, and finances. Given the dynamic nature of working with government stakeholders from national to school-levels, the (Sr.) Project Manager will be highly skilled in adaptive management and negotiation, revising project activities and timelines to support the DL scale-up best. The (Sr.) Project Manager will report to the IPA Ghana Country Director with dotted-line oversight from the Global Director of Policy.

job-details: Bluesquare is a rapidly growing tech company dedicated to improving global health through innovative digital solutions. Our work spans 30+ countries, partnering with organizations like the World Bank, WHO, and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. Join us to make a positive impact on global public health in a collaborative and flexible environment.for the DATIM project. The ideal candidate will have experience as an agile product owner and a deep understanding of DHIS2, as well as field experience. The candidate should possess the ability to articulate a clear software vision for the project, drawing on their extensive systems knowledge. While not a hands-on developer, they should be proficient in prioritizing the backlog to align with client needs. This individual will serve as the crucial interface between the general project manager, ensuring a deep understanding of priorities and their translation into actionable tasks. They will be accountable for delivery, client interactions, and the creation of a comprehensive roadmap for DATIM. Collaborative skills are key, as they will work closely with the IT project manager of the overall project and enterprise architects across the PEPFAR portfolio to drive successful project outcomes.DATIM is a US government funded project with the aim to collect all PEPFAR (AIDS relief programme) data in one DHIS2 powered data management system. This means integrating data flows from all government programmes and partners, but also, where possible, working with ministries of health is foreign countries to create an inclusive data repository.:1 December 2023, contingent on contract award.:The location can be remote, but the hiree will be expected to work partly at EST times (i.e. accommodate client meetings at that time).
